title: Mario Sagario
text:
Mario Sagario (born 29 June 1986) is an <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>an <a href="Rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Prop">prop</a> for <a href="Carrasco%20Polo%20Club">Carrasco Polo Club</a> and the <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguayan national rugby union team</a>.
Club career.
Sagario started his career in <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a> playing for <a href="Carrasco%20Polo%20Club">Carrasco Polo Club</a> in 2006.
In mid 2009, he moved to <a href="France">France</a> to play for <a href="US%20Dax">US Dax</a>. He spent a year playing in the reserves until he signed his first professional contract in August 2010. On 5 December 2010, he made his debut in the 24-13 away loss against <a href="Stade%20Montois">Stade Montois</a>. He played a total of 10 matches during the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Rugby%20Pro%20D2%20season">2010–11 season</a>.
On 21 August 2011, Sagario signed a new deal with <a href="Spain">Spanish</a> side <a href="UE%20Santboiana">UE Santboiana</a>. He played one season at the club, before returning to France to play for <a href="Pro%20D2">Pro D2</a> club <a href="RC%20Massy">RC Massy</a>.
Sagario signed a three-month contract with Irish <a href="United%20Rugby%20Championship">Pro12</a> side <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> in October 2015. His contract was extended for the rest of the 2015-16 season.
In mid 2016, he returned to his country to play again for <a href="Carrasco%20Polo%20Club">Carrasco Polo Club</a>.
International career.
Sagario has earned 51 caps for <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a> since 2006, scoring one try. He was involved in the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20-%20Americas%20qualification">2007</a>, <a href="2011%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">2011</a> and <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20qualifying">2015</a> <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">Rugby World Cup</a> qualifiers.
In mid 2014, he suffered an injury which prevented him from playing in the <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup%20%E2%80%93%20repechage%20qualification">2015 Rugby World Cup – repechage qualification</a> matches against <a href="Hong%20Kong%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Hong Kong</a> and <a href="Russia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Russia</a>.
In May 2015, he returned to the national team and later was called up for the <a href="2015%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2015 Rugby World Cup</a>.
